publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4555 Mr Frank McAveety: Congratulations to St Andrew’s Secondary, Glasgow—That the Parliament recognises the achievement of St Andrew’s Secondary School, serving the east end of Glasgow, in receiving one of the best reports of Her Majesty’s Inspectorate of Education; recognises that the school received five "excellents", more than any other mainstream secondary school in the state or private sector since the ratings were introduced, and that the school is a tremendous example in overcoming disadvantage and ensuring that pupils have the best opportunity in life; further recognises that leadership and teamwork between the head teacher, staff, pupils and parents can make a real contribution to the success of a school and commends the school and its commitment to "aim high and you’ve got the world at your feet", and takes pride in the contribution of St Andrew’s to the ongoing regeneration of the east end.

S2M-4555 Congratulations to St Andrew’s Secondary, Glasgow (lodged on 14 June 2006) Bill Butler*, Derek Brownlee*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Tommy Sheridan*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Rob Gibson*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Trish Godman*, Mr Charlie Gordon*, Cathie Craigie*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Maureen Macmillan*, Michael McMahon*, Karen Gillon*, Mr John Swinney*, Des McNulty*, Robin Harper*

S2M-4555 Mr Frank McAveety: Congratulations to St Andrew’s Secondary, Glasgow—That the Parliament recognises the achievement of St Andrew’s Secondary School, serving the east end of Glasgow, in receiving one of the best reports of Her Majesty’s Inspectorate of Education; recognises that the school received five "excellents", more than any other mainstream secondary school in the state or private sector since the ratings were introduced, and that the school is a tremendous example in overcoming disadvantage and ensuring that pupils have the best opportunity in life; further recognises that leadership and teamwork between the head teacher, staff, pupils and parents can make a real contribution to the success of a school and commends the school and its commitment to "aim high and you’ve got the world at your feet", and takes pride in the contribution of St Andrew’s to the ongoing regeneration of the east end. Supported by: Bill Butler, Derek Brownlee, Roseanna Cunningham, Tommy Sheridan, Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Alasdair Morrison, Rob Gibson, Ms Sandra White, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Trish Godman, Mr Charlie Gordon, Cathie Craigie, Dr Elaine Murray, Mr Jim Wallace, Maureen Macmillan, Michael McMahon, Karen Gillon, Mr John Swinney, Des McNulty, Robin Harper, Scott Barrie*, Patrick Harvie*, Jackie Baillie*, Frances Curran*, Janis Hughes*
S2M-4555 Congratulations to St Andrew’s Secondary, Glasgow (lodged on 14 June 2006) Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-4555 Congratulations to St Andrew’s Secondary, Glasgow (lodged on 14 June 2006) Karen Whitefield*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-4555 Congratulations to St Andrew’s Secondary, Glasgow (lodged on 14 June 2006) Nora Radcliffe*, John Swinburne*
S2M-4555 Congratulations to St Andrew’s Secondary, Glasgow (lodged on 14 June 2006) Donald Gorrie*, Pauline McNeill*
